author: lburnip
title: KFC customer horrified at biting into family bucket and ‘finding bloody chicken’
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments A MUM who claims she bit into a KFC chicken thigh to find it was full of blood says she was “absolutely horrified” and will never eat at the chain again. 
Hannah Schofield, 23, shared pictures of the meal she says she was given at the KFC in Belgrave Boulevard, Mowmacre Hill, Leicester on Tuesday. SWNS:South West News Service Hannah shared pictures of the ‘bloodied’ chicken on Facebook 
She said: “When I realised what we were eating I was absolutely horrified. 
“It was disgusting. 
“We have both had bad bellies for the last day or so. 
“It’s just not on – most definitely not ‘finger-lickin’ good’ that’s for sure.” 
The mum of two and her partner Ashley Spalding, 25, from Anstey, visited the takeaway for dinner that evening. 
She said: “It was strange because the drive-thru was really busy and when we ordered our food we were told there would be a 10-minute wait. 
“The server advised us to park up, but then when we passed the till they said our food was ready. 
“They must have just whipped the chicken in, got it out and served it to us.” SWNS:South West News Service 2 Hannah Schofield and partner Ashley Spalding outside the KFC restaurant in Leicester 
Hannah said the chicken was hot and everything seemed fine as they ate a few pieces and put the rest in the fridge. 
But when she bit into the leftover chicken the next day, she said her “stomach churned”. 
The mum said: “I could taste the blood, it was terrible. 
“I thought ‘oh my god!’ – I couldn’t believe it.” 
And a shocked mum was revolted after finding her KFC chicken was “black and lumpy” under the skin. 
Bakery shop assistant Hannah said she was just relieved that her children Maisy, six, and Lily, two, didn’t eat the chicken. 
She said: “Fortunately, it was only Ashley and I who had the chicken and the kids just ate some chips. 
“It was the chicken thigh with the bones in that was the problem because the chicken breast seemed okay. 
Hannah said she rang up the restaurant to make a complaint on Wednesday. 
She said: “I was told I had to come in later and bring my receipt. 
“We went in that evening and took the chicken with us, but at first I wasn’t offered a £16 refund. “The member of staff said I’d have to come back when the manager was in. 
“They said I could have a replacement meal on the house but I told them I would never be eating Kentucky Fried Chicken ever again. 
“I did eventually get my refund though.” 
Hannah shared her story, and photographs of the offending poultry on Facebook and her post has been shared more than 50 times. 
She said: “I was just so angry and wanted to let other people know – to warn them.” 
A KFC spokesman said: “We’re very surprised to see this, as we have strict procedures in place to ensure the quality and safety of our food. 
“We’ve not received any other similar customer complaints for this restaurant, but will be investigating this urgently. 
“We’re really sorry for Hannah and Ashley’s experience, so offered them a replacement meal and refund in restaurant.”
